sense.name: a nonfictional prose work, published in a magazine or newspaper
sense.examples: There was an interesting article in the newspaper about glass blowing. Bob writes review articles for two monthly magazines. Sally got her article published in Science.

sense.name: a single artifact, one piece, e.g., of clothing
sense.commentary: ARTICLE[+quantity][+one][+artifact] Note: a countable concept, so it can occur in the plural, thus more than one artifact can be involved
sense.examples: Several articles of furniture were stolen from the conference room last night. John found an article of clothing lying in the street. The airline supplied Mary with a kit of toilet articles when they lost her luggage.

sense.name: a section or clause of a legal document
sense.examples: The third article of the contract specifies the the obligations of the buyer. Our firm just filed the articles of incorporation with the state of Delaware. The congregation recited the articles of faith during the service. (formal clauses of religious belief)

sense.name: a grammatical part of speech, determiners
sense.examples: In English the indefinite article has two forms, 'a' and 'an'. Articles in German take markings for case, gender and number.
